cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 65 mi SSW of Freeport, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest toward the central Texas coast, then expected to slow, turn north and northeast, meandering along/east of the Texas coast and into Louisiana mid-week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Texas coast near the Matagorda/Port O’Connor area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Baffin Bay to Port Aransas, TX
weather_observation.warning_coast: Port Aransas, TX to Morgan City, LA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire middle and upper Texas coast and southwestern Louisiana coast
weather_observation.wind: Sustained tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph) with higher gusts expected beginning Monday afternoon/evening and continuing into Tuesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft surge possible in Matagorda and Galveston Bays, including the Freeport area, especially around times of high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: Totals of 5–10 inches with isolated 15 inches; flash and urban flooding probable.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes, dangerous surf and rip currents, prolonged minor river flooding.
